definition: according to/in accordance with/to shine/to illuminate/to reflect/to look at (one's reflection)/to take (a photo)/photo/as requested/as before
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to

sentences.english: Moon lights made the sea gleam like satin.
sentences.chinese: 月光把海水照得像绸子一般。

sentences.english: She asked which of the two lamps shone brighter.
sentences.chinese: 她问这两盏灯哪一盏照得更亮。

sentences.english: The sun itself sees not till heaven clears.
sentences.chinese: 太阳也要等天晴才照得明亮。

sentences.english: Its light was so bright that I couldn't even open my eyes .
sentences.chinese: 它的光芒照得我睁不开眼睛。

sentences.english: Afternoon sun, relaxing and warm the heart of Orange lit.
sentences.chinese: 午后的阳光，暖洋洋的照得内心橙黄。

sentences.english: Everyone came out well in the wedding photograph except the bridegroom.
sentences.chinese: 在结婚照片中除了新郎以外人人照得都不错。

sentences.english: A black square stands firmly, illumined red on one side.
sentences.chinese: 黑色的方块稳稳的伫立，其中的一面被照得通红。

sentences.english: The sun was about to rise, making the other side of the sky over the sea colorful.
sentences.chinese: 太阳即将升起，照得天的那端呈现出美丽的色彩。

sentences.english: The bright lights of the car dazzled me .
sentences.chinese: 汽车的明亮灯光照得我的眼发花。

sentences.english: The sun gleamed on naked swords.
sentences.chinese: 阳光把出鞘的剑照得闪闪发亮。

sentences.english: The harvest moon shone clear outside.
sentences.chinese: 中秋的满月在外面照得很亮。

sentences.english: The room was poorly illumed by only one candle.
sentences.chinese: 孤单单一只蜡烛把房间照得半明不暗的。

sentences.english: The sun makes people listless, not wanting to do anything.
sentences.chinese: 太阳照得人昏昏的，什么事情也不想做。

sentences.english: Sometimes too hot the eye of heaven shines, and often is his gold complextion dimm'd.
sentences.chinese: 有时天上的眼睛照得太热，而且经常是他的金子。
耀眼的灯光照得他眼花缭乱。

sentences.english: Sometimes too hot the eye of heaven shines.
sentences.chinese: 天上的眼睛有时照得太酷烈。

definition: to shine brightly/(fig.) to show promise/to be on the up and up
pitch-black/(fig.) to be completely in the dark
pitch-black/(fig.) to be completely in the dark
